title: Producer tries to save 3 cents per unit for profit and leads to sub standard product
text: I love print design is great after that. They likely spent less than a penny on the wire that holds it against your nose, so .. there's a big gap and you might as well not wear it! .. I fixed mine by cutting the top edge and removing their twist tie JUNK .. and putting in a 14 gauge wire .. it's copper and still likely cost lest than 1 penny!!  Also, there is NO adjuster on the ear loops .. I fixed that by using some white electric tape .. a 1 penny bead would work best. My head is (7-1/4) and it was extremely lose without that adjustment.  Besides all that I like it ..  To the producers!  spend the penny and I'll pay for it! .. sub standard products sell fewer .. you might get them by the gimmick of the American flag like me .. but I wouldn't buy it again or refer a friend .. so ..

text: Okay, first let me mention that the product arrived SO QUICKLY. When I saw it at my doorstep [today] I was completely shocked!!! I was expecting it to be here mid-late July. Oh man. I literally almost cried tears of joy haha. It's been in my hands for a few hours now, and I'm still buzzing with excitement. I got my name on the bottom and that's beautiful. text: The covers fit like a glove, and are marked either ‘top' or ‘front' on the back side so you don't accidentally put it on backward or upside down. title: Worth every penny. Beautifully made!
text:
Simply adorable! I bought these for my upcoming wedding. My colors are burgundy and persimmon, so I was thrilled to actually find "persimmon" and not just "burnt orange," etc. However the persimmon on this set is slightly more pink than orange when held next to the David's Bridal persimmon color sample, which is the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. In terms of quality it would get 10 stars!
I think the color is close enough that no one will really notice the difference. They will be too busy focusing on how beautiful the set is, rather than the exact color. You can tell it's very high lovingly hand made. It seemed a bit pricey at first, but I took a chance, purchased it, and I'm so glad I did! Once I received it and saw how well it was made, I would've even paid $100 for it. Excellent product!

title: Poor dye work
text:
This is one of those items I want to love. It's nice thick leather, well stitched, and attractive. Unfortunately, I have a few issues with it - the size is larger than I expected (I don't hold this against the product - and it's not the reason for the 3 stars - it's me not checking with a tape measure before buying) - it takes a very portable field notes and makes it the size of a paperback (with more grip). If you keep your field notes somewhere other than your pocket, this probably isn't too much of an issue. The thickness is a mixed bag - I love good thick real leather - but this is more thick than several field notes notebooks piled on top of each other. Again, depending on your use case this may or may not be an issue.

For me, these are minor problems (and I really wish there was a pen loop) - the major issue is the dye used. I've been using this for 2 weeks, and the dye is still coming out of the leather (I was being generous with giving it time to stop bleeding - I shouldn't have to wait for a purchased leather product to be usable without staining things around it). You can see the first page of my field notes - all of that is just from the first page resting against the leather.

Last Friday I had a meeting and slipped a business card in that I was handed - same thing - I took the business card out today (Monday), and it's covered in yellow/tan dye that's bled from the cover.

At this point, I dare not put it in a pocket, or leave it on a surface that can't easily be cleaned... and I'm considering just tossing it in the trash. Which is a shame, because it is beautiful in a bulky leather kind of way.

title: Rich, nourishing oil

title: Light, absorbent oil.
text: I had actually been looking at the other formulation when I decided to go with this one instead. I still want to pick up the other one for comparison, but Helios is a fantastic facial oil and I'm extremely happy with my purchase. The oil isn't heavy, which is a big point for me. I have an oily forehead, and oils that are too thick or that sit on the skin for a while seem to make everything worse. This oil is light - extremely light.. it took me a bit to realize that yes, it was actually on my skin to be smoothed in - and absorbs beautifully. I apply it directly with the roller and then spritz my face with some rose water toner before using fingertips to smooth the oil over my face evenly. I have had no breakouts, my skin is soft and supple but -not- oily, my dry areas look a lot better, my skin feels hydrated, and this is only after a few days of use. Every product is not going to be perfect for every person, but for me, this is a winner. Beautiful bottle to have on your counter as well!

title: Lots of fire and a great value
text: I have purchased over 10,000 carats of small opal rough over the past two years. Infinity Gems Art is the ONLY online vendor where the items delivered came close to the picture they have used. One thing to note is that all of these opal deals require the stones to be tumbled to remove the dirt, potch, etc. I have purchased from these guys several times and the stones always look good and clean up well. Additionally, the weight loss from tumbling is relatively minimal. Please take a look at other reviews I have made. I always try to leave honest and helpful reviews. Also, these stones are small. Roughly 300 stones to make up 500 carats. So realize that these are not suitable for cutting. They are small chips. For my purposes, they work very well.

title: Note to ATGATT bikers (others ignore)
text: As a car-free, full-time motorcyclist for 13 years, I've lost nearly a dozen pairs of earrings, esp. fish-hook styles, from the jostling they get when removing a proper-fitting, i.e., snug, full brainbucket.  I love the style of these and have already repurchased after losing or breaking some.  Two suggestions: (a) buy metal or double up the plastic earring backs to reduce the risk of loss and (b) take a needle-nosed pliers to crimp the ringlets that attach the motorcycle to the beaded hooks and regularly inspect them for pulling open.  Ride safely, Scooter Crone of Cayman

title: Leash latch broke on first outing
text:
First it came super pretty and the engraving was nice. However on our first outing with new collar and matching leash the leash latch broke as we were walking back to the car. Like the hardware itself snapped not a seam loose or she slipped her collar. I had a Great Dane running around freely in a busy parking lot. Scared to death and just thankful she wasn't hurt; she ran right for the car because she loves car rides so much. If my girl was a runner like some dogs I'd hate to think of what would have happened.
I reached out, showed photos and got a full refund so seller is great and probably had no idea I received such a faulty weak piece of hardware. It's like it looked metal but wasn't or something.

title: Exceptionally well made, great design, very comfortable to wear
text: I now have 4 of these rings, totally, totally love them. They're very comfortable and true to size. They're very well made, I'm really impressed. When I ordered the first one, I was assuming it would be kind of flimsy and bend. Nope, not at all. I wanted a memorial ring for my dog, to put his name on and be able to wear it. Other memorial jewelry was well, adorable I guess. Not something I'd want to wear. These are so well done by someone who is obviously a jeweler. The personalized imprint is very subtle and well done. All 4 of my rings have my dog's names on them. They'd be great as mother's rings too. Also, they're a great width for a thumb ring. I hope if you're reading this to decide whether to order I've convinced you. Oh, and the order turnaround is really fast, less than a week.

title: Delicate sterling silver bracelet with a great message
text:
When I first received my bracelet in the mail, I'll admit that I was a bit disappointed in the teeny print. But, not to worry. While the message is only readable when up very close, I've found that most people can tell that it says *something* and then ask to see it more closely. The response from most is, "I need one of these!"

While daintily narrow, the bracelet is a pretty good size otherwise and should fit most wrists (other than perhaps the very largest of wrists). It's quite flexible and will bend to fit however you want it to fit. As mentioned before, the stamped lettering is tiny and not that easy to see. The message is partly in cursive and partly in lower-case block lettering.

All in all, I'm pretty happy with the bracelet. And the message is perfect!

title: Nostalgic hand-knitted wool slippers are warm and cozy
text:
I ordered these because the photos of them gave me a huge wave of nostalgia. Every view of them--top, bottom, and side--look EXACTLY like the hand-knitted slippers that I made for myself and a few family members back when I was a kid learning to knit many moons ago. Those slippers have long since disappeared from my life (hmm, wonder where they went?) and I no longer have the details for making another pair -- nor the inclination to do so.

Well, they arrived and they're just what I remembered. Soft, yet "meaty," knitted pull-on slippers that are very well constructed. If I'm being honest with myself, they're probably more well made than my old ones were, since there aren't any too-tight or too-loose stitches here and there. But, hey, I was a kid when I made mine!

I like that they're soft but sturdy wool for warmth and durability. Before they arrived, I was a bit concerned that the slippers would turn out to be some bright fire-engine-red color, but the color is as shown in the product page photo -- a nice dark, not-quite-burgundy red. As you can see in those photos, there is NO non-slip bottom added--they're entirely made of knitted wool yarn.

I've enjoyed mine as a warm and cozy trip down memory lane, but they'd also be a nice gift for friends who appreciate handcrafted items.

title: Not a quality item. Disappointing

The small quilled bluebirds on the nest on the front of the sheet of paper are really cute and the idea of an empty nesters card is a really good one. But this isn't a card. It's a square sheet of cheap paper, not even card stock quality, so whatever note you want to write you're writing on the back side of the flimsy paper. It would be hard to even write on the back side because it's all bumpy. Highly disappointing and I would not order this again. The only way I can see using this is if I purchase my own card stock and make my own card with it and glue this to it.  I'll purchase higher quality items from Etsy.

title: This mahlstick is now one of my most prized possessions!
text: My mahlstick from PaintedPresence (Hand Crafted Treasures) is my favorite painting tool. They are absolutely the best vendor I have ever dealt with in 20 years as a frequent Amazon customer! I had a small issue caused by the delivery service, and PaintedPresence made the situation right within minutes, and with extraordinary grace and concern for me. The mahlstick I purchased was handmade by them, and it is a lovingly constructed, perfectly suited to holding my painting hand away from the canvas as I add fine detail to my paintings. I will treasure this mahlstick for years and years, not only because it is such a beautiful and useful addition to my studio, but because every time I see it I am reminded of how thoughtfully and gracefully they treat their customers. I can't wait to purchase more items from them. I recommend that every painter buy a mahlstick from them, just for the pleasure of dealing with such a wonderful and creative team!

title: Love earrings. Hated over packaging.
text:
5 stars for the earrings.
I ADORE these earrings and their versatility. Because of the placement of the post, you can turn them to point down, out or even up.

2 stars on packaging/presentation.
The earrings were inside a plastic baggie, laying on top of a jewelry card (they could have been pierced through like you normally find earrings for sale on). This was inside a box, with polishing snippet and silica pack, inside of another plastic bag and 3 odd bits of paper info.
Just post the earrings on the decorative card inside the box with the polishing snippet and some anti-tarnish paper, then use a sticker to keep the box sealed. Would be much more eco-friendly in a world overrun with plastics. When everything but the earrings ends up in the trash once received, it's just wasteful.

5 stars for quick shipping.

title: Terrific item! (Can't wait for economies-of-scale to drive down $/unit cost!)
text:
Very superior to the multitude of ultimately fragile Rosaries I've carried over the years. So much so that I'm willing to grant the makers what must be a serious profit margin, on a per unit sale. Because, after one look at the materials and assembly, versus the price charged, they clearly must net up to 75% profit over their gross assembly costs...

HOWEVER, this is, after all, a relatively new product. I can't imagine it was a low-cost op for them to market this and to acquire some relatively effective distribution channels. And, after all, absent those costs incurred on properly bringing the item to market, the makers would just be selling "onesy-twosey style," on Etsy or somewhere similar.

SO... I will be keeping an eye on this item. And once the makers have recouped their R&D, marketing and G/O-H costs--assuming sales have continued to climb--I'll look forward to buying the item in bulk. Because it will make for a terrific gift item to MANY different sorts of people in my life.

title: Beautifully crafted authentic Turquoise Ring
text: I traveled to Albuquerque 6 months ago and purchased a similar ring in Old Town, then I lost the ring. I ordered this genuine turquoise ring as a replacement ring specifically because I felt so closely channeled to the genuine turquoise stone's enlightening properties and I wanted the new ring to be crafted by Indigenous people with whom I have great admiration for their ages old craft. I got exactly that!  My purchase included a letter of turquoise authenticity, what area the turquoise was mined, the 925 silver setting and which Indigenous peoples crafted the ring. I was thrilled with the historic value as a keepsake ring I can be proud of and on Route 66, no less! I ordered a size 9 which is true to size as shown in the picture, it fits perfectly and I'm very happy with my purchase! I would like to extend my wish for a Happy National Indigenous Peoples Day 10/10/22 and give a big shout out to this vendor for helping me replace my lost turquoise ring with genuine style, brilliance and grace. It's a historically perfect, beautifully crafted turquoise ring! Just what I wanted, Thank you!
